derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Italian, person loving the arts', from dilettare 'to delight', from Latin delectare

entry.tran: （尤指艺术方面的）半吊子，浅薄涉猎者
entry.def: You can use dilettante to talk about someone who seems interested in a subject, especially in art, but who does not really know very much about it.

means.word_mean: 1. an amateur who engages in an activity without serious intentions and who pretends to have knowledge
1. showing frivolous or superficial interest; amateurish;
